org.vaadin.artur.griddesign.client.escalator

Interface Cell


  • public interface Cell
    Representation of a cell in an Escalator

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getColspan()
      Returns the colspan for the cell.
      int getColumn() 
      Element getElement()
      Return the root element for this cell.
      Escalator getEscalator() 
      int getRow() 
      Widget getWidget()
      Returns the widget attached to this cell
      boolean isVisible()
      Checks if the cell is visible and contents should be rendered.
      void setColspan(int colspan)
      Sets the colspan for the given cell.
      void setWidget(Widget widget)
      Attaches the given widget to this cell (and detaches the current widget if there is one)

    • Method Detail

      • getEscalator

        Escalator getEscalator()

      • setColspan

        void setColspan(int colspan)
        Sets the colspan for the given cell. Setting this larger than 1 will cause the subsequent cells never to be rendered.
        Parameters:
        colspan - the colspan for the cell

      • getColspan

        int getColspan()
        Returns the colspan for the cell. Default is 1.
        Returns:
        the colspan for the cell

      • getWidget

        Widget getWidget()
        Returns the widget attached to this cell
        Returns:
        the widget in this cell or null if no widget has been attached

      • setWidget

        void setWidget(Widget widget)
        Attaches the given widget to this cell (and detaches the current widget if there is one)
        Parameters:
        widget - The widget to attach

      • getRow

        int getRow()

      • getColumn

        int getColumn()

      • getElement

        Element getElement()
        Return the root element for this cell. The CellRenderer may update the class names of the element, add inline styles and freely modify the contents.
        Returns:

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Checks if the cell is visible and contents should be rendered. A column can be invisible for instance when the previous column has colspan > 1.
        Returns:
        true if contents should be rendered in the cell, false otherwise
